net.cloud.server.file

Class FileServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cloud.server.file.FileServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ShutdownService

    public class FileServer
extends Object
implements ShutdownService
    The front of the file server module. Deals with FileRequests. The file server accepts a FileRequest and will attempt to fulfill it. This occurs through a chain of classes and calls behind this facade of sorts.
    Create a FileRequest object and submit it here. The request can then be waited upon or a listener can be attached to it which will be acted on when the request is fulfilled.
    An example of the usage to obtain a BufferedReader on a file:
    BufferedReaderRequest req = new BufferedReaderRequest(FileAddressBuilder.newBuilder().createCommandScriptAddress("echo"));
    req.waitForRequest();
    BufferedReader fileReader = req.getFileDescriptor();
    See Also:
    FileRequest, FileAddressBuilder

    • Method Detail

      • instance

        public static FileServer instance()
        Obtain a reference to the singleton instance of the FileServer, to submit requests to.
        Returns:
        A reference to the FileServer

      • submit

        public void submit(FileRequest<?> request)
            throws FileRequestException
        Submit a FileRequest to the server, so that it is eventually handled and assigned a file descriptor. When it is handled, if there is a listener attached, the listener will also be called.
        Parameters:
        request - The FileRequest to submit
        Throws:
        FileRequestException - If the request could not be submitted

      • submitAndWaitForDescriptor

        public <T> T submitAndWaitForDescriptor(FileRequest<T> request)
                                 throws FileRequestException
        Slightly different that submitting a request and waiting for it, this convenience method will actually use the calling thread to fulfill the request rather than relying on the file server thread. This should only be faster, since the calling thread would just be waiting anyways and the file server thread may be busy.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the file descriptor object. Should be inferred from the request.
        Parameters:
        request - The request to submit and wait on
        Returns:
        The file descriptor that is being requested
        Throws:
        FileRequestException - If any of these convenient steps fail

      • fileExists

        public boolean fileExists(FileAddress address)
        Check to see if a file exists. This is not a typical request and is not handled asynchronously. Rather, the method is here to maintain the division of responsibility.
        Parameters:
        address - The location of the file
        Returns:
        True if the file already exists

      • getShutdownHook

        public ShutdownHook getShutdownHook()
                             throws NullPointerException
        Obtain the ShutdownHook for the FileServer. It will stop the service, so no more requests will be accepted. The hook is created during construction, so a NPE should not be a concern. Still, it's a possibility.
        Specified by:
        getShutdownHook in interface ShutdownService
        Returns:
        The ShutdownHook capable of stopping the FileServer
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the hook has not yet been created
